ranges.notes: Major holiday - most attractions closed, cold weather (0-4°C), post-celebration cleanup, limited transport
considerations: Excellent for photography with fewer crowds

ranges.notes: Post-holiday recovery, gradual reopening, winter sales begin, very cold (-2-3°C)
Traditional celebrations, bakeries busy, winter sales peak
ranges.culturalSignificance: Important Austrian tradition - try traditional pastries at local bakeries

traditionalVenues.locations: Throughout Graz, especially in Old Town and Lend district

considerations: Visit early for best pastry selection

ranges.notes: Coldest period (-4-2°C), possible snow, ideal for indoor activities, very low tourism
Gradual warming (0-4°C), excellent museum conditions, winter activities available
Winter continues, cold (0-6°C), fewer crowds, excellent museum time
Pre-Valentine's period, gradual warming (2-7°C), winter sales ending

schoolHolidays.description: Austrian school holidays - increased family tourism

ranges.notes: Romantic atmosphere, special dining events, busy restaurants, book 2-3 weeks ahead

romanticVenues.specialPackages: Many hotels offer Valentine's packages with champagne and dinner

ranges.notes: Post-Valentine's, school holidays continue, gradually warming (3-8°C), spring hints
Early spring transition, variable weather (0-11°C), increasing daylight
Spring awakening, pleasant temperatures (5-14°C), perfect for walking
considerations: Perfect time for Mur river walks

ranges.event: Spring Equinox & Easter Markets (if Easter falls in March)
ranges.notes: Spring officially arrives, excellent conditions (8-15°C), Easter markets if applicable
ranges.location: Hauptplatz, Eggenberg Palace gardens, city center

easterMarkets.hauptplatz: Traditional Easter market with local crafts and food
easterMarkets.eggenbergGardens: Spring garden awakening and Easter egg hunts

specificVenues.lendplatz: Local Easter market with regional specialties

ranges.notes: Fun cultural atmosphere, spring in full bloom, perfect spring weather
Spring in full spectacular bloom, ideal weather (8-16°C), photography paradise

ranges.event: Easter Monday (if Easter falls in April)
ranges.notes: Public holiday, family activities, spring celebrations, festive atmosphere
Perfect spring conditions (10-18°C), comfortable temperatures, ideal sightseeing

specialConsiderations.easter: Major Christian holiday affects opening hours and creates family tourism spike
specialConsiderations.weather: Most stable spring weather but sudden showers possible

ranges.notes: Public holiday, pleasant spring weather, some closures but outdoor activities available

ranges.event: Springfestival (dates vary, often late May/early June), Ascension Day, Whit Monday (Public Holidays - dates vary)
ranges.notes: Excellent month. Warm weather (9-21°C), lush greenery. Ideal for exploring the city, parks, Mur river path. Start of festival season.

springfestival.description: Major electronic music and art festival
springfestival.ticketInfo: Various ticket options available, some events free
springfestival.accommodation: Book 3-4 months ahead, expect 40-60% price increase
springfestival.transportation: Tram network extended hours, night buses available

ranges.event: Styriarte Music Festival starts, Corpus Christi (Public Holiday - date varies)
ranges.notes: Start of summer. Warm, long days (12-24°C). Ideal for outdoor activities, visiting lakes (Schwarzlsee), enjoying beer gardens. Styriarte brings classical music.

styriarte.ticketInfo: Tickets range from 25€ to 120€, book 6-8 months ahead
styriarte.accommodation: Book 4-6 months ahead, expect 30-50% price increase
styriarte.transportation: Special shuttle services to Eggenberg Palace
styriarte.dressCode: Smart casual to formal, depending on venue

ranges.event: Styriarte continues, La Strada Street Theatre Festival (usually late July/early Aug)
ranges.notes: Peak summer month. Warmest temperatures (14-26°C), can be hot and humid. Busy with tourists and festivals. Great for outdoor activities but expect crowds.

laStrada.booking: Most events free, some indoor shows require tickets
laStrada.ticketInfo: Most street performances free, indoor shows 15-35€
laStrada.schedule: Performances throughout the day, peak hours 2pm-8pm
laStrada.transportation: Tram network serves all venues, walking distances manageable

ranges.event: La Strada Street Theatre Festival may continue
ranges.notes: High summer season. Warm weather continues (13-25°C). Busy tourist period.
Public holiday. Peak summer tourism. Many locals may take vacation.
Late summer. Still warm (12-25°C), good for outdoor activities. Graz Food Festival often occurs this month.

ranges.event: Aufsteirern Festival, Steirischer Herbst begins (dates vary)
ranges.notes: Often beautiful, sunny 'Indian summer' days (10-21°C). Ideal for city exploration, hiking, visiting the wine region. Major cultural festivals start.

aufsteirern.description: Largest folk culture festival in Austria

specificVenues.hauptplatz: Main festival square with traditional music
specificVenues.lendplatz: Local food and wine from Styria

aufsteirern.ticketInfo: Most events free, some workshops require registration
aufsteirern.accommodation: Book 6-8 months ahead, expect 50-80% price increase
aufsteirern.transportation: Extended tram hours, special festival buses

steirischerHerbst.ticketInfo: Individual event tickets 15-45€, festival passes available
steirischerHerbst.internationalArtists: Features artists from around the world
steirischerHerbst.accommodation: Book 4-6 months ahead, expect 30-50% price increase
steirischerHerbst.transportation: All venues accessible by tram, walking distances manageable

ranges.event: Steirischer Herbst continues, Lange Nacht der Museen, Graz Marathon, Klanglicht (dates vary)
ranges.notes: Autumn colors. Cooler but often pleasant weather (5-15°C). Good time for cultural events, museums, city walks. Wine region is beautiful.

klanglicht.description: Light art festival illuminating the city
klanglicht.photography: Excellent for night photography, bring tripod
klanglicht.transportation: Extended tram hours, walking recommended for full experience

ranges.notes: Public holiday. Cultural events continue.
Late autumn. Days getting shorter and colder (3-12°C). Prepare for possibility of rain.
Public holiday. Quiet day, many businesses closed.
Often grey, cold, and potentially damp (1-8°C). Low tourist season. Good for indoor activities like museums and cafes.
Christmas markets begin opening towards the end of the month, bringing a festive atmosphere despite the weather.

specificVenues.hauptplatz: Main Christmas market with traditional stalls

christmasMarkets.transportation: Tram network serves all markets, walking distances manageable

ranges.notes: Full festive swing. Christmas markets are the main attraction. Cozy atmosphere. Book accommodation early.

christmasMarkets.description: Multiple Christmas markets across the city

specificVenues.hauptplatz: Main Christmas market with traditional stalls

christmasMarkets.transportation: Tram network serves all markets, walking distances manageable

ranges.notes: Public holiday, but markets and some shops may be open due to Christmas shopping season. Very busy.
Magical time to visit for the festive atmosphere. Very popular, expect crowds.
Public holidays. Most things closed, including markets (some close early on 24th). Very quiet family time.
Inter-holiday period. Some visitors, city relatively quiet compared to pre-Christmas.
Celebrations in the city, often events on Hauptplatz. Restaurants booked out.

specificVenues.restaurants: Special New Year's menus throughout city

newYearCelebrations.restaurantBooking: Book 2-3 months ahead, expect 50-100% price increase
newYearCelebrations.accommodation: Book 4-6 months ahead, expect 80-120% price increase
newYearCelebrations.transportation: Extended tram hours, night buses available, expect delays
newYearCelebrations.safety: Large crowds expected, plan transportation in advance

spring: Exploring Eggenberg Palace gardens as they bloom
Walking or cycling the Murradweg (River Mur path)
Enjoying outdoor cafes in the Old Town
Hiking on lower trails around Graz (e.g., Platte, Plabutsch)
Wine tasting in South Styrian region
summer: Swimming at Schwarzlsee or other nearby lakes
Exploring the Old Town and Lend district
Hiking in the surrounding hills and mountains
Taking the Schlossberg lift/funicular for views
autumn: Visiting the South Styrian Wine Route (wine tasting, Buschenschanken)
Enjoying autumn colours in parks (Stadtpark, Eggenberg)
Visiting farmers markets for harvest produce (pumpkin!)
winter: Enjoying the festive lights and atmosphere in the Old Town
Enjoying traditional Styrian food in cozy restaurants
Taking day trips to nearby ski resorts (conditions permitting)

scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds, best value
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds, good value
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism, fair value
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very high crowds, limited value
scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or limited activities, poor value

tram.strikes: Possible any time, more common autumn/winter
tram.frequency: Every 5-10 minutes during day, 15-20 minutes evenings

walking.distances: Old Town walkable in 2-3 hours, Schlossberg climb: 15-20 minutes
walking.paths: Pedestrian zones in Old Town, Mur river paths

cycling.bikePaths: Murradweg along river, City center bike lanes, Schlossberg access limited

buses.coverage: Serve areas not reached by tram, Frequency: Every 15-30 minutes
buses.routes: Bus 30 to Eggenberg Palace, Bus 31 to Kunsthaus

valuePricing.strategy: Book 2-3 months ahead for best rates

accommodation.airConditioning: Essential July-August, many historic hotels lack AC

recommendedAreas.oldTown: Historic atmosphere, walking distance to attractions
recommendedAreas.lend: Trendy district, good restaurants, slightly cheaper
recommendedAreas.eggenberg: Quiet area, near palace, good for families

accommodation.bookingTips: Book 4-6 months ahead for festivals, Consider apartments for longer stays, Check for festival packages

closures.august: Many local restaurants close for owner vacations
closures.holidays: Christmas Day, New Year's Day, May 1st
closures.sunday: Many traditional restaurants closed Sunday evening

diningTimes.tips: Book ahead for dinner, lunch menus offer better value

monthlyHighlights.january: Winter sales, cozy museums, authentic local experience
monthlyHighlights.february: Valentine's romance, fewer crowds, cultural immersion
monthlyHighlights.march: Spring awakening, Easter markets, perfect temperatures
monthlyHighlights.april: Spring peak, ideal weather, Easter celebrations
monthlyHighlights.june: Longest days, Styriarte festival, pre-peak crowds
monthlyHighlights.july: Peak summer, La Strada festival, outdoor activities
monthlyHighlights.august: Hot weather, festivals continue, many locals away
monthlyHighlights.september: Post-peak perfection, Steirischer Herbst, ideal conditions
monthlyHighlights.november: Cozy atmosphere, cultural season, indoor activities
monthlyHighlights.december: Christmas magic, Advent markets, festive atmosphere

weatherNotes.spring: Variable weather, layers recommended, occasional rain
weatherNotes.summer: Warm to hot, occasional heatwaves, evening thunderstorms possible
weatherNotes.autumn: Gradually cooling, beautiful colors, comfortable for walking
weatherNotes.winter: Cold but rarely extreme, occasional snow, indoor activities recommended

transportation.walking: Best in spring and autumn, challenging in extreme weather
transportation.cycling: Excellent in spring and autumn, bike lanes available

accommodation.advanceBooking: Recommended 3-6 months ahead for peak season

eggenbergPalace.tips: Visit early morning or late afternoon for fewer crowds

schlossberg.tips: Climb early morning for sunrise views, evening for sunset

seasonalHighlights.winter: Snow-covered views, ice possible on paths

kunsthaus.tips: Visit during weekdays for fewer crowds

landeszeughaus.tips: Combine with other Old Town attractions

culturalTips.language: Basic German helpful, English widely spoken in tourism
culturalTips.etiquette: Greet with 'Grüß Gott', respect quiet hours
culturalTips.traditions: Try pumpkin seed oil, attend local festivals
culturalTips.customs: Sunday is family day, many shops closed
